value.0: You will sorely regret having crossed my path... Begone from my chambers, fool!
<StartAction>[A thick sweat has appeared on Varhun's brow, bringing a fog over his lenses. Still, you sense that he is giving you a glare of complete loathing.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Varhun's face has turned a dark red, his breath coming in short, seething gasps.]</Start> Outwitted by the <LastName> family! It matters not, though, for you will be too late to save your father!
Chancellor Varhun will not see the end of his days upon the gallows! No! If it is my fate to perish, I shall at least take you with me, <FullName>!
<StartAction>[Varhun cackles evilly.]</Start> I'm afraid you'll never have the chance to find out, <FirstName>, for if I am to die, at least you shall come with me!
<StartAction>[Chancellor Varhun appears enraged by the intrusion into his quarters.]</Start> What is the meaning of this? Why have you disturbed me so?
Settle down, Chancellor. We simply wish to have a chat with you. <FirstName> here believes you may have some information regarding a plot against Magistrate Okaris...
That is outrageous! Preposterous! I, Chancellor Varhun, would never stoop to such treachery! I'll have you stripped of your rank for this, Captain!
Now, now, Chancellor. There's no need to get so upset. I merely wish to assure the <lad/lass> that there is no truth behind <his/her> allegations. After all, you have nothing to fear... Correct?
<StartAction>[Varhun appears quite uncomfortable.]</Start> Well, of course not! How could you even suggest that I would? <StartAction>[Despite his words, Varhun appears quite nervous.]</Start>
Good. <FirstName>, you may feel free to look around as you like, both here and in the Chancellor's quarters.
Begone, <FirstName>! I have no more time for your foolish accusations!
<StartAction>[The Chancellor gives you a glare of complete distaste and sneers.]</Start> Keep your threats to yourself, <lad/lass>! Now, begone from my chambers!
<StartAction>[Chancellor Varhun, High Chancellor of Ghaarak, second in command only to your father, does not even bother to look up as you approach his desk.]</Start>
Speak your business quickly, <FirstName>, for I have little time to spare in idle chatter with you! Some of us don't have as much time to waste as your father does!

<StartAction>[The Chancellor smirks at your remark.]</Start> Well, isn't that nice... but as you can see, I am responsible for doing all the work around here while your father takes the glory for running this city, so why don't you bugger off!

<StartAction>[Varhun's mouth dips in a sarcastic leer.]</Start> It is good to see that your training at the Academy has your sharpened your wits so, <boy/girl>! Now, please be on your way, for I have little desire to speak with you further!

Yes, yes, it seems the Empire is quite eager to get their hands on the <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName>! No doubt you'll get the position as well, for your father could do no wrong in the Empire's eyes, including the siring of his children!

Not that it matters. You follow your own counsel as you see fit! I suppose it is fine for the <LastName> family to break the rules when they feel the need, while the rest of us must heed the letter of the law!

I doubt it will even matter that you keep your own company, only caring for your own personal wants and desires! Oh no, it would be too much that the <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName> would have to follow the rules as well!
Not to mention you never break any rules, never take any risks! Oh no, that would be below the station of the <LastName> family, now wouldn't it?

So, to answer your question, yes, it appears you have garnered some attention to yourself. They'll probably even send you back to rule this city when they're done training you, and I'll rot away as your lackey...

Good riddance! I have little need or desire to speak with you further, so feel free to head right out the door! Now, I have to get back to the real work around here, which you and your father so blissfully ignore...

So am I... Now, leave this old man to his work, for someone around here has to keep record of the affairs of the city! Go along and join your father in your happy little realm of bliss, and just let Varhan take care of all the real work...
<StartAction>[Varhun gives you a rather cruel look.]</Start> Yes, here's a little bit of wisdom... Get out of my chambers before I grow sick with your presence!

I could... but I don't believe I will. Your observers are keeping an eye on you from a distance, attempting to judge your character and other such nonsense. I think it will be more entertaining to let you squirm for a while...

Don't fear, though... I'm sure the Empire's love of your father will be more than enough to secure your acceptance. After all, the <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName> could do no wrong, now could <he/she>?

<StartAction>[Varhun turns his glance up to you quickly, the light reflecting off his lenses resembling burning flames.]</Start> Do not come here to banter with me, <boy/girl>! Speak your peace, and be done with it!

<StartAction>[Varhun smirks at you from underneath his lenses.]</Start> You can prove nothing, <lad/lass>, so don't even try to come here with your idle threats! There is little you can do against me!
Yes, I do. Now rid me of your annoying presence!
<StartAction>[Varhun seems unimpressed by your threat.]</Start> Begone from my chambers, <FirstName>! I have no more reason to deal with you...
So, you think to expose me? Me?! I have been responsible for every great achievement in this city, while your father takes all the credit! I'll not stand for it anymore... oh no, I won't...
<StartAction>[Varhun seems to find your offer amusing.]</Start> I would almost be willing to take you up on such an offer... It would be quite satisfying to see Okaris' <CUSTOM6001> betray him...
However, I'm afraid you know too much already, and I cannot take the risk of you leaving this chamber... No, I will simply have to finish what Mikel failed to do...

Not completely my doing... It seems I am not the only one who wants your father dead! But do not concern yourself over that, <FirstName>, for you won't live long enough to see my plans come to fruition...
Oh, just a nice little surprise... but you won't live long enough to see it!
<StartAction>[Suddenly, Varhun begins chanting, and you hear the doors to his chamber clang shut, trapping you inside.]</Start> This little spell should keep things quiet while I deal with you...
<StartAction>[Varhun's glazed eyes stare blankly ahead.]</Start> Come to think of it, I think I do... I feel like taking a little nap...
<StartAction>[Varhun quietly walks from the chamber, leaving it open for you to search.]</Start>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
Any final words to say, Varhun, before they sent you to the executioner's block?
Your days are over, Chancellor Varhun! I have all the proof I need of your treachery!
Chancellor Varhun, you are hereby placed under arrest for treason against Magistrate Okaris and the Sharakhan Empire.
Enough of your threats, Varhun!
Tell me what is planned against my father, Chancellor!
Thank you, Captain.
This isn't over yet, Varhun...
I think you and I need to talk about this letter I found in your desk...
I was merely stopping by to say hello.
<StartAction>[Leave the elderly Chancellor Varhun to his work.]</Start>
Sounds as though you don't much care for my father, Chancellor...

My instructor at the Academy mentioned that I was being observed by an elite training facility of the Empire. He mentioned that you had overhead this information, and I was hoping you could tell me more about it.
I think I've had enough of you for one day, Chancellor... I'll be on my way.
Sorry I asked...
Sounds like you've got some issues with our family, Chancellor Varhun...
Any helpful words of advice?
Can you tell me a bit more? Perhaps a bit regarding what I should expect?
I think you and I need to have a little talk about Mikel Ravenclaw...
I know all about your dealings with Mikel to have me assassinated, Chancellor...
You have a point...
Perhaps not yet, but I will soon enough, Varhun. You can count on that.
I have a letter here that I believe was written by you... one arranging for my death...
I care little for what happens to my father, but I would like to ensure my safety...
So this was all your doing?
What have you planned against my father?
Don't you have somewhere you need to be, Varhun?
